Article_Name: On Covid Re-Exposure And Testing Needs, What You Must Know
News Info: While Omicron continues to infect people across Australia and the world, many people who've already had COVID will likely be re-exposed to the virus.

Article_Name: In Chhattisgarh, Paramilitary Officer Killed In Gunfight With Maoists
News Info: An officer of the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) and another security personnel injured in an encounter with Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district.

Article_Name: France's "Canada-Like" Anti-Covid Curbs' Protesters Move Towards Paris
News Info: Thousands of opponents of Covid rules were encamped on the outskirts of Paris early Saturday after driving in convoys from across France, intent on entering the city in defiance of a ban by authorities who are determined to prevent any blockade.

Article_Name: No Proposal To Close Any Railway Recruitment Board: Railway Minister
News Info: Amid reports regarding the closure of the Thiruvananthapuram Railway Recruitment Board, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday clarified that no proposal has been sent by the ministry to close any Railway Recruitment Board.

Article_Name: Double Engine Government Gave Free Ration, Vaccines: Uttarakhand Chief Minister
News Info: Ahead of the Uttarakhand Assembly elections, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said that double engine government provided free ration, vaccines to people.

Article_Name: "Motivated Comments Not Welcome": India After US Remarks On Hijab Row
News Info: Amid a global uproar on the hijab row, India today said that motivated comments on internal issues not welcome. Muslim students' demand in several Karnataka colleges are demanding that they be allowed to attend classes wearing a hijab.

Article_Name: In Poll Pitch, Uttarakhand Chief Minister Promises Uniform Civil Code
News Info: Mr Dhami claimed that the law will enhance social harmony, boost gender justice, strengthen women empowerment and help protect the "extraordinary cultural-spiritual identity and environment of the state".

Article_Name: Photons In, Selfie Out: World's Most Powerful Telescope Sees Its 1st Star
News Info: Star light, star bright, the James Webb Space Telescope has seen its first star (though it wasn't quite tonight) -- and even taken a selfie, NASA announced Friday.

Article_Name: Video: Bhopal Man Dives Under Moving Train To Save Girl Fallen On Tracks
News Info: Returning to his factory, Mohammed Mehboob, a carpenter by profession, did not know that his bravery would be put to test.

Article_Name: Delhi's Air Quality "Moderate", Minimum Temperature At 8 Degrees
News Info: The national capital witnessed a clear sky on Saturday morning with the minimum temperature settling at 8 degrees Celsius, two notches below the season's average, the India Meteorological Department said.

Article_Name: At India-Australia Talks, A Vow For Inclusive Growth In Indo-Pacific
News Info: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday welcomed the reopening of the Australian border which will help stranded Indian students and visa holders to return to Australia.

Article_Name: "When A Large Country...": India Flags China's Border Moves At Quad Meet
News Info: On China's foreign minister criticising the Quad, Mr Jaishankar said that our actions and stance are very clear, and criticising it repeatedly "doesn't make us less credible".

Article_Name: No Approval Given For Movie On Soldier In Kashmir. Centre Explains Why
News Info: The Defence Ministry refused to grant a 'No Objection Certificate' (NOC) to a movie based on the relationship between an army soldier serving in Kashmir and a local boy because it would raise security issues, said Union Minister Ajay Bhatt.

Article_Name: US Expands Pacific Presence With Soloman Islands Embassy After 29 Years
News Info: The United States plans to re-establish an embassy in the Solomon Islands, a senior State Department official said Saturday, 29 years after downgrading its diplomatic presence there.

Article_Name: Voting Begins For 4 Civic Body Elections In West Bengal
News Info: Voting has begun for all four municipal corporationelections in Siliguri, Bidhannagar, Chandannagar, and Asansol in West Bengal on Saturday with COVID-19 protocols in place. It started at 7 am and will continue till 5 pm.
